item.title: Trump's Tylenol warning echoes past misconceptions about mothers and autism
item.description: Medical scholars say, efforts to find a singular cause for autism has historically led to scrutinizing parents and fueling stigma about autism

item.title: The U.N. utters the word: Dementia
item.description: For the first time, the United Nations has issued a political declaration pledging to address dementia. Will it make a difference?

item.title: Trump advises parents on hepatitis B vaccine. Here's why doctors say he's wrong
item.description: It's unusual for Presidents to give medical advise. But this week President Trump told parents to delay giving their kids a hep b shot until they turn...

item.title: VIDEO: Trump and scientists disagree on Tylenol and autism. Who do Americans believe?
item.description: President Trump linked Tylenol to autism despite little medical evidence. How are Americans meant to make important decisions about their health at th...

item.title: Leucovorin for autism? Many scientists — and parents — are skeptical
item.description: President Trump says an old drug that acts like a vitamin can reduce autism symptoms in many children. The science doesn't support that claim.
